content:
1. Basic features of styles in Word, including character styles and paragraph styles.
2. Benefits of using styles in Word documents, including consistency and accessibility.
3. Creating new styles in Word and customizing default styles.
4. Creating an accessible PDF from a Word document using styles.
5. Evaluating the use of styles in a Word document for accessibility and structure.
6. Designing and implementing a set of styles to improve the accessibility and structure of a Word document.
7. Understanding how to use the self-assessment quiz to test understanding of the concepts learned.
8. Familiarity with using Microsoft Word, including creating and editing Word documents.
9. Ability to access and watch video tutorials and read articles on the internet.
10. Basic computer skills, such as using a laptop or computer, and opening and saving files.

This list covers the key concepts a user must understand to successfully complete the activities and utilize the resources. Understanding these concepts is crucial for achieving the learning objectives in the 4-week self-study program.
